text: It is non-ideal that the RC runs with assertions enabled. Makes it hard to know if peoples benchmark problems are real or an artifact of assertions (e.g. <https://github.com/FluxML/Zygote.jl/issues/898>)

text: I wonder if something got overwritten on S3? I definitely didn't enable assertions when I triggered the buildbots.

elements.text: I wonder if something got overwritten on S3? I definitely didn't enable assertions when I triggered the buildbots.

text: Usual builds on a commit have assertions enabled by default, which is why I explicitly trigger non-assert builds, but all builds for a single commit always get put in the same bucket and prefix with the same name. It would be nice if tagged commits get assigned a different name.

elements.text: Usual builds on a commit have assertions enabled by default, which is why I explicitly trigger non-assert builds, but all builds for a single commit always get put in the same bucket and prefix with the same name. It would be nice if tagged commits get assigned a different name.
